hero.title: Effective prompt frameworks, instantly.
hero.subtitle: Over 30 professional frameworks ready to use. Test with Gemini, OpenAI and ZAI models and get superior results in seconds.
hero.searchSubtitle: Quickly find the perfect framework for your project

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Use Promptify in 3 simple steps to transform your prompts into professional results

step1.title: Choose the Framework
step1.description: Explore over 30 professional prompt engineering frameworks. Search by category, difficulty or use the search bar to find the perfect one for your use case.

step2.title: Configure APIs
step2.description: Go to Settings and enter your API keys for OpenAI, Google Gemini or ZAI. Keys are saved only in your browser, never on our servers.

step3.title: Generate and Copy
step3.description: Enter your prompt and click Generate. The AI will optimize your prompt following the chosen framework. You can copy the result or continue refining it.

howItWorks.privacyNote: Privacy guaranteed: Your API keys are saved only in your browser's localStorage and are never sent to our servers. They are used only to communicate directly with your chosen AI providers.

framework.promptSentInfo: This is the complete prompt that will be sent to the AI

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your API keys to test AI frameworks. Keys are saved only in your browser.
privacyItems: API keys are saved only in your browser's localStorage
They are never sent to our servers
They are used only to call OpenAI, Gemini or ZAI directly
You can remove them at any time

openai.name: OpenAI
openai.description: Use GPT-4 to test frameworks. Get your key at platform.openai.com

gemini.name: Google Gemini
gemini.description: Use Gemini 2.0 Flash to test. Get your key at ai.google.dev

zai.name: ZAI
zai.description: Alternative provider. Get your key at z-ai.dev

guides.title: Prompt Engineering Guides
guides.subtitle: Learn to master the art of prompt engineering with practical guides, best practices and advanced techniques.

tip1.title: Be Specific
tip1.description: The more details you provide, the better the result. Specify format, tone and desired length.

tip2.title: Provide Context
tip2.description: The model doesn't know your background. Always describe who you are and what you want to achieve.

tip3.title: Use Examples
tip3.description: Few-shot learning works. Show 2-3 examples of the result you expect.

tip4.title: Iterate and Test
tip4.description: The first prompt is rarely perfect. Test, measure and optimize based on results.

guides.notFoundDescription: The guide you're looking for doesn't exist.

footer.description: The professional platform to discover and master the most effective prompt engineering frameworks
